msbt.message: The claws of Deinonychus were so long! Poor dear, it must have been terribly difficult to walk. Not as difficult as walking in high heels, thoughâ€”I can tell you that, .
The antlers on this Megaloceros! They'regigantic! They must've been a pain in the neck for the poor deer.
Such a sleek, aerodynamic physique. Still, I'll never understand how these giant Pteranodons took flight!
Look at those teensy wittle hands! They may have a rowdy reputation, but T. Rexes are quite adorable!
The plates along the Stegosaurus's back are quite elegant, but that spiked tail gives me the shivers!
With its long, slender neck and small head, the Brachiosaurus has a rather elegant shapefor a dinosaur.
The Mammoth's tusksthey're so enormous! They must have caught them on trees all the time.
The anomalocaris looks like it has the body of a shrimp and the head of an insect. It's ratherunnerving.
The eusthenopteron's fins were quite sizeable. Oh, how they must have soared through the water!
Eeegads! The dunkleosteusit looks more like a monster dressed in fancy armor than it does a prehistoric fish!
My, the Quetzalcoatlus has such a light and slender skeleton.Well, I suppose it would need to in order to fly, .
They call this "coprolite," which sounds so much more elegant than what it isdinosaur droppings!
The juramaia was an important prehistoric mammal. In fact, it was nicknamed the "Jurassic Mother"!
Oh, ! This fossil was one of your donations, was it not? Well, it's absolutely wonderful.
Why, just look at this ancient . I supposethis is where I get my fabulous looks from.
